lead_paragraph: The United States 8-kilometer running championship, to be held Saturday in Central Park, lost a star yesterday when Dathan Ritzenhein withdrew because of an injured left foot. His coach, Brad Hudson, said that Ritzenhein, the 24-year-old Olympian, sustained a minor injury while running last week on grass in Tallahassee, Fla. If Ritzenhein’s recovery stays on schedule, he will run in the Cardinal Invitational next month in Palo Alto, Calif., and probably the Healthy Kidney 10 kilometers in May in Central Park.
